revisionDesc.change: Vote - AcceptText - As Delattre (he is correct about the diaereses) AND Lin1 ¯ⲛ¯ⲧⲟⲟⲧⲥ so also every other overstroke in this text (note according to ed. it's ¯ⲛⲙ¯ⲙⲁⲕ, not ¯ⲛ¯ⲙⲙⲁⲕ; also, I note that the overstroking on the papyrus varies from that of the edition; I assume that we follow the edition.) Lin4, before second *stauros* (an actual stauros), *slanting-stroke*. The apostrophe after ¯ⲙ¯ⲡⲣⲉϥⲣ should also be indicated.

Vote - AcceptText - Accept. General remark: one must isolate the words of Greek origin in the Coptic text (i.e. to put outside the <::> the Coptic elements. Line 1: ⲡ<:λόγος=grc|reg|ⲗⲟⲅⲟⲥ:>. Line 1: ⲛⲁⲓ̈ the diaeresis shouldn't be ⲛⲁ ⲓ(¨)? Line 2: Greek word and typo ⲁⲙⲫⲓⲃⲁⲗⲉ and not ⲁⲙⲫⲓⲱⲁⲗⲉ: ⲉⲛⲉⲕ<:ἀμφιβάλλω=grc|reg|ⲁⲙⲫⲓⲃⲁⲗⲉ:>. Line 3: the diaeresis: ⲁ ⲓ(¨)ⲥϩⲁ ⲓ(¨)? Line 3: ⲡⲉⲓⲗⲟⲅⲟⲥ is word of Greek origin: ⲡⲉⲓ<:λόγος=grc|reg|ⲗⲟⲅⲟⲥ:>. Line 5: . . should be .2. General remarks: the crosses (l. 1, 3, 4, 5 are in fact chi-rho crosses (see the plate), but are edited as normal crosses (in the edition).
Coptic and Greek text entered anew
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)

div.ab:
ⲉⲓⲥ ⲡλόγοςⲗⲟⲅⲟⲥ ⲛⲧⲟⲟⲧⲥ ⲛⲧⲉⲕⲙⲛⲧⲥⲟⲛ ⲛⲅⲉⲓ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲛⲧⲁϣⲁϫⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲕ
ϫⲉ ⲉⲛⲉⲗⲁⲁⲩ ⲙⲡⲉⲑⲟⲟⲩ ⲧⲁϩⲟⲕ· ⲁⲩⲱ ϫⲉ ⲉⲛⲉⲕἀμφιβάλλεινⲁⲙⲫⲓⲃⲁⲗⲉ
ⲁⲓⲥϩⲁⲓ ⲡⲉⲓλόγοςⲗⲟⲅⲟⲥ ⲛⲁⲕ Ἀνανίας προεστὼς στοιχεῖ μοι ὁ λόγος
ἐγράφη μηνὶ Μεσορὴ κγ· ἰνδικτίονος
ⲧⲁⲁⲥ ⲙⲡⲣⲉϥⲣ ϩⲟⲧⲉ ⲛⲥⲟⲛ ⲡⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲁⲡⲉ ⲙⲫⲙϫ ϩⲓⲧⲛ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲁⲛⲁⲛⲓⲁⲥ προεστώςⲡⲣⲟⲉⲥⲧⲱⲥ

list.item: 5 Between ⲡⲁⲡⲁ and ⲡⲁⲡⲉ there is a decussis (X-shaped sign in connection with sealing), cf. M. Hasitzka in SB Kopt. II 914. On the decussis in general see K. Vandorpe, Seals and Stamps from Graeco-Roman and Byzantine Egypt (2010) in Trismegistos or directly http://lhpc.arts.kuleuven.ac.be/seals/Overview/Letters.htm
